meanings.definition: A projection on the bottom of a boat to provide directional stability.
meanings.sent1: The skegs on the boat helped it stay on course in the strong currents.
meanings.sent2: The sailor checked the skegs before setting off on the voyage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on one of the skegs, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: The skegs acted like anchors, keeping the boat steady in the turbulent waters.
meanings.sent5: The bright red skegs under the boat gleamed in the sunlight, guiding its path.

meanings.definition: A fin or projection on a surfboard to improve stability.
meanings.sent1: The surfer's skillful use of the skegs allowed for smooth rides on the waves.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the skegs are securely attached to the surfboard before hitting the water.
meanings.sent3: The playful dolphin swam circles around the skegs, showing off its agility.
meanings.sent4: Balancing on the skegs, the surfer felt like a graceful dancer on the water.
meanings.sent5: The colorful skegs on the surfboard added a touch of style to the beach scene.

meanings.definition: A metal projection on the bottom of a shoe for traction.
meanings.sent1: The hiker's boots had sturdy skegs that gripped the rocky terrain effectively.
meanings.sent2: Before the race, the athlete checked the condition of the skegs on their shoes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal the shiny skegs from the shoes left outside.
meanings.sent4: With each step, the skegs dug into the ground, providing excellent grip.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out skegs on the old shoes left a trail of marks on the muddy path.
